content: GOP Should Remove ‘Traditional Marriage’ Plank from Party Platform, Whitman Says (CNSNews.com) - The government should have no say about marriage, and the plank in the Republican Party platform that calls for preserving marriage between a man and a woman should be scrapped, former New Jersey Gov. Christine Todd Whitman (R) told CNSNews.com. Furthermore, the U.S. military should not differentiate between ****sexuals and heterosexuals, said Whitman. The former governor spoke Friday at the Log Cabin Republicans’ (LCR) 2009 convention and symposium in Washington, D.C. “Well, I am somebody who believes in the separation of church and state and that the government, frankly, ought to be out of the business of marriage entirely,” Whitman told CNSNews.com after her speech. “It ought to be everybody – heterosexual, ****sexual. When you go down and register to get married, that’s when the legal transfer of everything occurs and that’s a legal recognition of a relationship – and if you want to get married in a church, a temple, whatever, and you find one, great!” she said. content: Same sex marriage is first recorded among Egyptians, those mostly of the higher status folks frequenting the courts. Roman recorded, for tax purposes, same sex marriage (Egypt under Rome had the most, about 15% of all marriage.) The Greeks had their versions before all that. And there is some evidence of it among Christians now and then in history. It may have been the case in Rome and Corinth when Paul writes to them about what might be same-sex marriage (but probably is something else.) John Boswell, who I believe was the head of Yale's History Dept., wrote a book about it "Same-Sex Unions in Premodern Europe" And he wrote some others along that line. Various cultures had different takes on it over the eons, some frowned on it, others thought of it highly. Some debated the nature of sexual union (who was gay and who was straight depending on who penetrated who, etc.) It's been around awhile. After all, it is sex and for much of human history sex for sex's sake was the rule - even in worship. What complicates the issue for our culture is our tendency to filter everything through this foggy filter of the supposed Judaic Christian cultures taboos. Since those taboos were not wide spread until the 5th or 6th Century, same-sex marriage was not seen as amoral but sometimes as unusual or not so desirable. Anyway, there is plenty of good history about it out there if one wants to read it.
